intro: Conomorpha longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled conomorpha, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and compound leaves with a pinnate structure. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Conomorpha longistyla is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and flies, contributing to its ecological significance.
